title: AMQP non-durable queue creation does  not work
body:
### Describe the bug

I have an artemis  server, with a setup that allows auto creation of queues and addresses, and a client that uses the reactive-messaging-amqp module to receive events through a queue. The module fails because the user can't create a durable queue, but I specified that I wanted a non-durable one.

### Expected behavior

A non-durable queue should be created when the client tries to connect to the queue system and the queue does not exist.

### Actual behavior

The client fails because it does not have permission to create a durable queue.

### How to Reproduce?

See reproducer project: https://github.com/iompo/amqp-connection

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM Temurin-11.0.16.1+1

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.11.2.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

gradle 7.3.3

### Additional information

_No response_
